page.title: 19Kilmux House.
page.content: Kilmux House is located in the North-East corner of the study area,it is situated on a South-East facing slope and it is 145m above sea level. The house was built in 1830 by a Mr.James Blyth Fernie.One of the unusual features is the entrance hall which is circular and has eight doors leading from it.All the doors are curved.The house is a Listed Building. The house is surrounded by trees of which there are different varieties. One of them was blown down in a storm in 1984;it was a Monkey Puzzle tree. The farmer,Mr.Arnott, has 300 sheep, 150 cattle.The farm is 363 acres;it used to be more.The following crops are grown:Wheat,Barley,Turnips, Potatoes and Kale.Kilmux means"Home of the Wild Pig". There is evidence of the existence of monks having lived near Kilmux House.
